title: Geth (web3 and RPC) error when response contains large amounts of data
body:
Hi there,

I'm trying to scan past events of a smart contract (ERC20 with standard ABI).
When the number of past blocks to scan is relatively low (10k) the response is fast with little load on the server. If I increase the amount of blocks to 100k both RPC and web3 return an error. I'm pasting the output of a RPC connection since it seems to handle more blocks from testing(bisection).

Sample code for reproduction:
`/* Include libraries */
var Web3 = require('web3');
var bigInt = require("big-integer");
var abi = require('human-standard-token-abi');

/* Web3 */
if (typeof web3 !== 'undefined') {
    web3 = new Web3(web3.currentProvider);
} else {
    web3 = new Web3(new Web3.providers.HttpProvider("http://192.168.1.201:8545"));
}
let sca = web3.utils.padLeft('0xd26114cd6EE289AccF82350c8d8487fedB8A0C07', 64);
const transfer = web3.utils.keccak256( "Transfer(address,address,uint256)" );
const contract = new web3.eth.Contract(abi, "0xd26114cd6EE289AccF82350c8d8487fedB8A0C07");

contract.getPastEvents( {
    fromBlock: "5033945".toString(16),
    toBlock: '5104945'.toString(16),
    address: '0xd26114cd6EE289AccF82350c8d8487fedB8A0C07',
  }
).then( (events) => { console.log( events ); } );`
#### System information

Geth version: `1.8.11-stable-dea1ce05`
OS & Version: Linux, Ubuntu 16.04
